captions.text:
Get a full house in Hyrule with these Legend
of Zelda playing cards and keep your eyes
on this Space Invader Clock.
I'm Jake, and this is episode #2 of Game LUT.

If you tried to "catch 'em all" but instead caught
a cold, choose this Pokeball sweater and a
pika...pika...chooo tissue holder.

Or, regain your strength with some health
energy potion from your Gameboy decaled fridge.

But, luckily, you can't get sick because you're
invincible...tshirt, which will look good

while playing your Nintendo, Super Nintendo,
Sega Genesis all in one console. It even comes

with two wireless controllers and ports so
you can plug in your old controllers.

If you want more retro gaming goodness then
check out GOG.com. They sell classic PC games

like Baldur's Gate, Theme Hospital, Postal,
and more - all the games are DRM free and
super cheap.

For something even cheaper, go to Valve's
thinkwithportals.com where you can download

the Portal 2 comic and the Portal 2 soundtrack
for free.

But, before you do, be sure to wear your Portal
cufflinks, it's what Cave Johnson would have

wanted, and give someone special this Half-Life
Lambda necklace. It will go nicely with these
potion earrings.

Maybe write them a nice note with these do-it-yourself
8bit pop up cards.

And then woo them with some video game bras
like this Xbox controller or this rhinestone

Pokeball bra. The ladies love them. Your mom
sure did!
TROLOLOLOLOL....tshirt.

Now, let's get realistic with our Mario Kart
RC cars from firebox.com, and our Pokemon

Anatomy tshirts which show the poke-guts of
some of the most popular characters.

For even more realism download the one-man
made MOD ICEnhancer for GTA4 which turns the
graphics from this....to this...

If you prefer gaming on the small screen,
connect your iPad/iPhone or Android device

to the 8bit controller to play d-pad style
classics like Pacman, Missile Command, or
Pong.

Once you've drained your phone, charge it
in this Nintendo controller dock, and check

out these incredible video game prints by
artist Maggie Ramey.

For the serious art collector, get this life-size
Big Daddy and Little Sister statue that you'll

be Bioshock-ed to found out only costs $6,490...
plus $1,449 for shipping.

But lets get something a bit more light, stackable
Tetris lights...that illuminate when they
touch.

And, remember, if you like it, you shoulda
put an Assassin's Creed ring on it.

Links to everything can be found in the description
below.
I'm Jake and, as always, thanks for watching.
